page.title: 15BUTCHERS
page.content: THE BUTCHER'S IS APPROX. 150 YEARS OLD.THE BUSINESS HAS BEEN IN THE HANDS GARRETT FAMILY SINCE 1866.NOW, THERE ARE 2 PEOPLE WORKING IN THE SHOP AND ONE PERSON WORKS IN THE ADJACENT SLAUGHTER HOUSE.THE ONLY MEATS SOLD ARE ,LAMB, PORK AND BEEF.THERE ARE 8 LAMBS AND 1 BEAST SLAUGHTERED PER WEEK.ALTHOUGH IN 1971 BRITAIN CHANGED TO DECIMAL CURRENCY, UP UNTIL THE MIDDLE OF 1980 GARRETT'S BUTCHERS WAS STILL TRADING IN OLD MONEY. IMPERIAL WEIGHTS ARE STILL USED.DEREK TAYLOR, NOT A MEMBER OF THE GARRETT FAMILY,HAS BEEN EMPLOYED THERE FOR 35 YEARS.MRS. GARRETT HAS BEEN WORKING THERE FOR NEARLY ALL HER 89 YEARS.THE EQUIPMENT IN THE SHOP HAS CHANGED,THERE ARE NEW SCALES, A BACON MACHINE AND A FREEZER.EXTERNALLY, THERE IS A 35 YR. OLD TILED ANIMAL FRIEZE OF A COW, PIG AND A SHEEP.
